alert.note: Alert for Banner; Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN CHEYENNE...EASTERN KIMBALL...SOUTHWESTERN MORRILL AND SOUTHEASTERN BANNER COUNTIES THROUGH 600 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Dix, or 12 miles southeast of Kimball, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation and outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Potter and Dix. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 24 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
